result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Harley David Barrington
Current: 2601 Indiana Avenue, Apt 1, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 11-16-2015)
Prior: 2409 Helen St, Stevens Point, WI 54481

Defendant Harley David Barrington in court with attorney William G. Weiland. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CT273, 14CT292, 14TR3565, 15TR243, 15CM58

9:17 a.m.  Court calls the case.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
  Makes additional statements to the Court. 
Court questions the defendant. 

Defendant enters a plea of: 
 
14CT273 - GUILTY
14CT292 - GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Atty Cousins states the facts to support the charges. 
Court questions Atty Cousins re: facts for 14TR3656.

14TR3656-
Atty Cousin amends to a 16-19 mph over.  
Atty Weiland concurs.
Defendant enters a GUILTY plea. 
Court finds the defendant guilty.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CT273, 14CT292.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Weiland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
14CT273 & 14CT292 - Pay fine of $150 plus costs on each count including the DNA surcharge on each count. 
14TR3656 - Pay $250.90. 
Court questions defendant re: employment.  
Defendant indicates he just started a job thru a temp agency. 

BY THE COURT:  Pay $75 per month at a minimum.  Informs the defendant that if he loses his job, he is to go to the Clerk of Courts office.  First payment is due March 16th.  

BY THE COURT:  15CM58 & 15TR243 are dismissed and read-in.
Status conference on March 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Court quashed warrant same day later in the afternoon.

Attorney William G. Weiland in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:11 a.m. case is called.  Defendant is not present.  Court questions whether he was expected to be present.
Court states there was a bond hearing on 2/9/15.    Bailiff to check in the defendant is in jail.

9:15 a.m. court recalls the case
The bailiff reports the defendant is not in jail.  
Court orders Bench warrant - BODY ONLY

*****Court recalls case at 2:53 p.m.  ADA Cousins and Atty Weiland and Defendant are all present now.  Defendant received Public paperwor stating his court date was at 1:30 p.m.  Court quashes the warrant.    Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
P/NG entered.
BTC: Bond continued.
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.

ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 

Defendant is employed by Superior Health Linen in Plover.

State requests a $200 cash bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  2/9/15  @ 9:00 a.m.  in Branch 2
